qas.question: When did Eduard Shevardnadze gain full membership in the Politburo?
Who was responsible for Shevardnadze's membership?
Who was minister of foreign affairs prior to Shevardnadze?
Which person did Gorbachev kick out of the Politburo on the first of July?

context: On <a0_0>July 1, 1985<a0_0/>, <a1_0>Gorbachev<a1_0/> promoted Eduard Shevardnadze, First Secretary of the Georgian Communist Party, to full member of the Politburo, and the following day appointed him minister of foreign affairs, replacing longtime Foreign Minister <a2_0>Andrei Gromyko<a2_0/>. The latter, disparaged as <a3_0>"Mr Nyet"<a3_0/> in the West, had served for 28 years as Minister of Foreign Affairs. Gromyko was relegated to the largely ceremonial position of Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet (officially Soviet Head of State), as he was considered an "old thinker." Also on July 1, Gorbachev took the opportunity to dispose of his main rival by removing <a4_0>Grigory Romanov<a4_0/> from the Politburo, and brought Boris Yeltsin and Lev Zaikov into the CPSU Central Committee Secretariat.
